Massachusetts Commonwealth requires taxes to support schools
Northwest Ordinance authorizes the sale of public lands to support education
Horace Mann argues that schools promote economic well-being
National Teachers’ Association forms in Philadelphia, forerunner to the National Education Association
Reconstruction begins. State education policy centralized in most Southern states
U.S
Committee of Ten recommends standard high school curriculum for college admissions
Carnegie units” proposed for high schools
American Federation of Teachers founded
Ellwood P. Cubberley’s Public School Administration published
George Strayer and Roger Haig recommend that New York State adopt a minimum foundation program to fund education
Court decides Brown v. Topeka Board of Education, calling for an end to segregated schools
Milton Friedman suggests voucher programs
James Conant publishes The American High School Today
Wisconsin enacts first public employee collective bargaining law; covers teachers
One-day strike in New York City forces district to bargain with the United Federation of Teachers
Civil Rights Act enacted. Authorizes Equality of Educational Opportunity study and prohibits federal funding of segregated facilities
Elementary and Secondary Education Act enacted
Coleman releases Equality of Educational Opportunity, known as the “Coleman Report
Court decides Green v. New Kent County, requiring integrated schools
National Assessment of Educational Progress authorized
Power equalization (or guaranteed tax base) educational finance system proposed
Swann v. Charlotte-Mecklenburg allows busing as a remedy to integrate school districts
1 finds that school districts segregated by race without deliberate segregation may still be subject to desegregation orders
Court finds that education is not a “fundamental right
Bradley requires that mandatory desegregation remedies be confined to single school districts
Tuition Tax Credit Act is debated and fails in Congress; would have allowed taxpayers to deduct private school tuition
U.S. Department of Education becomes a cabinet-level department
National Commission on Educational Excellence issues A Nation at Risk
National Governors’ Association issues Time for Results
President Bush convenes the Charlottesville Education Summit with governors. It is only the third time any U.S. president had officially met with the country’s governors
